passages.text: Management Roundtable post 1H'25 Results - Key takeaways

Holcim's management hosted a sell- side roundtable where they gave more colour on the the developments in the business. Management highlighted Holcim's growth vision to be the 'one stop shop' and sustainable construction solution provider, along with regional outlook and growth focus. More details on the key discussion points below.

NeutralShort-Term View: Upside, expires 04-SEP-25Price (28 Aug 25 17:30)SFr67.00Target priceSFr65.00Expected share price return-3.0%Expected dividend yield3.0%Expected total return0.0%Market CapSFr37,981MUS$47,384M

Citi Research is a division of Citigroup Global Markets Inc. (the "Firm"), which does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the Firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision. Certain products (not inconsistent with the author's published research) are available only on Citi's portals.

Germany outlook: pricing is weak but to improve in 2026 with second allocation period of EU ETS Phase 4 (2026- 2030). Pricing to increase from Jan, and volume to be flatish in 1H'26 and then slowly ramping up in H2. Germany momentum has turned positive, but volume will come later. Germany is the most fragmented market in Europe, expected to see consolidation in the coming years as smaller players struggle under new EU ETS. The group is looking to consolidate the market, buying plants and possibly converting into calcined clay production. Volume recovery requires accelerated decarbonization as the sector there is running short of CO2 credit. Holcim's German plants are in running at close to \(100\%\) alternative fuel in its German plants and with low clinker ratio. Further decarbonization in the near- term driven by lower clinker ratio, use of construction demolition materials, etc.
Pricing over volume: Will always go for price increase rather market share, and believe any market share is temporary. Currently not seeing losing market share in key markets.
EU ETS: too early to say what the new benchmark will be from 2026. According to EU Commission the new benchmark will be available in Oct. Hoping to buy just negligible amount of credit in 2026.

Europe strategy: is all about sustainable construction, and solution provider. Would like Holcim to become the partner of choice from foundation to flooring, roofing etc. To achieve this could need major acquisition (referring to deal of CHF billions) and such acquisition needs to be a 'system'. Would like to have full vertical integration, and make multiple sales in a project.

European capacity: Will see capacity reduction in the next 4- 5 years. Holcim has shut down a few plants in France and Spain, and will convert some existing plants to produce calcium clay. Think utilization has the potential to go back to \(70 - 80\%\) , above \(80\%\) maybe just for some countries.

LatAm strategy: Disensa created opportunities, and would like Holcim to become one- stop shop. Currently have \(\sim 2000\) Disensa shops, with 170 shops added in 1H'25; aim to have 5000 by 2030. Light side products have lower margin and don't mind seeing \(1\% - 2\%\) margin contraction on that. Alternative fuel in LatAm is 1/3, Europe 2/3, so huge opportunity there. When improving alternative fuel from \(30\%\) to \(40\%\) , could see \(5 - 10\%\) cost reduction in clinker production.

LatAm outlook: Mexico seeing improving momentum in industrial and infrastructure, including several rail projects in the pipeline. The new government also commits to residential development starting with 180k new homes. Ecuador improving, Argentina stabilizing.

APAC outlook: North Africa has very positive momentum, including markets such as Morocco, Egypt, etc. These counties have similar EBIT margin to Latam. China is seeing pricing recovery, although pricing is still low compared to 3- 4 years ago. In Australia, the deal done by JV with HEI last year (BGC Cementitious) helped consolidate the market. Australia needs a CO2 mechanism which will create opportunities for local players.

Sustainability: Holcim facility in Montcada (Barcelona) has been certified for its ECOCycle technology. Investment in such factory is not huge at all. Recycling represents huge potential, and would buy more recycling business to accelerate. Also would scale up calcined clay business not just in Europe but also North Africa, Latam.

Net zero product: cement pricing will already up significantly by the time net zero cement is introduced. Could see \(20 - 35\%\) green premium for net zero on top of the cement price at that time. EcoPact and EcoPlanet at that time will become standard products.

Demand outlook in the second half is expected to be positive across all of the group's three divisions. While US market this year has been an overhang to peers, Holcim is the only name under our coverage that has no exposure to the North American market following the spin- off. Latam continues to have good margin momentum and EU volume recovery could be a catalyst for 2H. We expect the strong earning growth momentum of the group to continue and likely outpace peers this year

We apply a DCF- based sum- of- the- parts valuation method. We arrive at the enterprise value using a WACC of \(7.1\%\) and a terminal growth rate of \(1\%\) , including investments in joint ventures & associates. We then deduct net debt, minority interest, and pensions from the enterprise value to reach our target price of CHF 65.
We identify the following risks to the achievement of our target price and investment thesis:
Higher/lower- than- expected prices resulting in margin expansion/compression should the operating environment get easier/tougher in its key markets.
Higher/lower- than- expected volumes, the impact of which would be magnified by the high operating leverage in the business.
Shortfall in the delivery of growth vs guidance, which could be a negative catalyst for the stock.
Higher- than- average moves in its key currency exposures, which could be a catalyst on either side, although the impact of currencies is largely translational.

Analysts' compensation is determined by Citi Research management and Citigroup's senior management and is based upon activities and services intended to benefit the investor clients of Citigroup Global Markets Inc. and its affiliates (the "Firm"). Compensation is not linked to specific transactions or recommendations. Like all Firm employees, analysts receive compensation that is impacted by overall Firm profitability which includes investment banking, sales and trading, and principal trading revenues. One factor in equity research analyst compensation is arranging corporate access events between institutional clients and the management teams of covered companies. Typically, company management is more likely to participate when the analyst has a positive view of the company.

Guide to Citi Research Fundamental Research Investment Ratings:

Citi Research stock recommendations include an investment rating and an optional risk rating to highlight high risk stocks. Risk rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned.

Investment Ratings: Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of 15% or more or 25% or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign "Rating Suspended" status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as "—" and "—" respectively in the rating history price chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned "Under Review" status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re- establishing a rating and

investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short- term volatility or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management. Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.

Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in reaction to one or more specific near- term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds 15% against the direction of the call (unless over- ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock's fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer- term total absolute return expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings- distribution- disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution- disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share- price movement will not materialize as expected.

For the purposes of disclosing recommendations other than for equity (whose definitions can be found in the corresponding disclosure sections), "Buy" means a positive directional trade idea; "Sell" means a negative directional trade idea; and "Relative Value" means any trade idea which does not have a clear direction to the investment strategy.

Forecasts are not a guarantee or reliable indicator of future performance. Card Insights. Where this report references Card Insights data, Card Insights consists of selected data from a subset of Citi's proprietary credit card transactions. Such data has undergone rigorous security protocols to keep all customer information confidential and secure; the data is highly aggregated and anonymized so that all unique customer identifiable information is

removed from the data prior to receipt by the report's author or distribution to external parties. This data should be considered in the context of other economic indicators and publicly available information. Further, the selected data represents only a subset of Citi's proprietary credit card transactions due to the selection methodology or other limitations and should not be considered as indicative or predictive of the past or future financial performance of Citi or its credit card business.
